title: upload of big files fails with ssl proxy
body:
(i apologize in advance if this bug is already known.)

i've been having this issue for quite some time now (i refer to this problem in my forum post from jan '13 <https://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=3841&start=20#p18858> which concerned version 4.5.5), but i will report it now as it still seems to persist in oc6 rc2.

when i try to upload a file that is greater than ~130mb through the web interface, the upload begins but will just terminate shortly afterwards (after 3-4 retries within 1-2 minutes) for no apparent reason. i believe an error message is supposed be displayed at the top, but i only see a small orange box appear without any visible message (which is also a bug in itself i presume). i do have the upload limit set to the max of 2gb.

i can upload big files with no issues when i use oc without the ssl proxy settings but always fails with files over 130mb when i do have the ssl proxy configuration enabled. i can also upload files that are under 130mb without no issues when i have the ssl proxy enabled.

my configuration is as follows:
- hosted on a shared hosting
- ssl proxy enabled via .htaccess and config.php
- mysql 5.5.30

i do not find any error messages in owncloud.log or in the admin menu.
